description: From French improviser; ultimately from Latin improvisus.

verbs.description: improvise (third-person singular simple present improvises, present participle improvising, simple past and past participle improvised)

entries.meaning: To make something up or invent it as one goes on; to proceed guided only by imagination, intuition, and guesswork rather than by a careful plan.
examples: He had no speech prepared, so he improvised.
They improvised a simple shelter with branches and the rope they were carrying.
